greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least nonnegative integer k such that n*2^k - 1 is composite.
comment: A063377 is an essentially identical sequence, although with a slightly different definition, different initial terms, and different offset.
reference: Carl Pomerance, Problem 81:21 (= 321), in R. K. Guy problem list.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
R. K. Guy, editor, Western Number Theory Problems, 1985-12-21 & 23, Typescript, Jul 13 1986, Dept. of Math. and Stat., Univ. Calgary, 11 pages. Annotated scan of pages 1, 3, 7, 9, with permission.
program: (PARI) A339579(n) = for(k=0,oo,my(t=(n*(2^k))-1); if((t>1)&&!isprime(t), return(k))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 24 2020
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 24 2020
